skill.name: content-research-writer
skill.description: Assists in writing high-quality content by conducting research, adding citations, improving hooks, iterating on outlines, and providing real-time feedback on each section. Transforms your writing process from solo effort to collaborative partnership.
skill.summary: Assists in writing high-quality content by conducting research, adding citations, improving hooks, i...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only instructions for AI writing assistance. No scripts, network calls, file access beyond standard AI capabilities, or environment variable access detected.

content.user_title: Research and write better content with AI assistance
content.value_statement: Writing quality content requires research, structure, and iterative refinement. This skill provides a collaborative framework for outlining, researching with citations, improving hooks, and receiving section-by-section feedback to elevate your writing.
actual_capabilities: Creates structured article outlines with research markers
Conducts research and adds proper citations to content
Improves hooks and introductions for better engagement
Preserves writer's voice and style throughout
Performs final review for flow, clarity, and consistency
limitations: Does not write complete articles without user collaboration
Cannot access private or paywalled sources directly
Does not verify factual accuracy of all cited claims
Relies on user for final publishing decisions

use_cases.title: Create SEO-optimized articles
use_cases.description: Research topics, structure outlines, and produce well-cited blog posts that engage readers.

use_cases.title: Document with sources
use_cases.description: Write tutorials and documentation with proper references and expert quotes to build credibility.

use_cases.title: Develop authority content
use_cases.description: Craft compelling thought leadership pieces that reflect your unique voice and perspective.

prompt_templates.title: Create outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an outline for an article about [topic]. Ask me any clarifying questions about audience, length, and goals first.

prompt_templates.title: Research topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Research [specific topic] and add citations to my outline. Find recent data, expert quotes, and real examples.

prompt_templates.title: Improve hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Here's my introduction: [paste text]. Help me make the hook more compelling with better options and explain why each works.

prompt_templates.title: Full draft review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my complete draft for flow, clarity, consistency, and citations. Provide specific suggestions for improvement.

output_examples.input: Help me create an outline for an article about remote work productivity.
output: ## Hook - Consider opening with: A statistic about productivity gains or a relatable story about work-from-home challenges
## Introduction - Context on remote work trends - Problem statement: Common productivity pitfalls - What this article covers
## Main Sections - Section 1: Setting up your workspace - Section 2: Time management strategies - Section 3: Communication best practices - Section 4: Avoiding burnout
## Conclusion - Summary of key points - Action items for readers - Final thought on sustainable remote work
## Research To-Do - Find recent productivity statistics - Source remote work case studies - Add expert quotes on focus time

best_practices: Work in VS Code for long-form writing sessions to maintain context
Save research separately in a dedicated research.md file for easy reference
Request feedback one section at a time rather than waiting for the full draft
anti_patterns: Asking for a complete article in one prompt without iterative feedback
Skipping the outline phase and starting with random drafting
Ignoring the skill's suggestions on voice and tone consistency

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It uses web search for research tasks and provides writing guidance.

faq.question: How long should my articles be?
faq.answer: The skill adapts to any length. Specify your target word count or format when starting. Blog posts typically range from 1000-3000 words.

faq.question: Can I use this for technical documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill handles code examples, step-by-step instructions, troubleshooting sections, and maintains technical accuracy through iterative refinement.

faq.question: Does this skill store my content?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides instructions. Your content stays in your Claude Code session and any files you create locally.

faq.question: Why is my hook not engaging readers?
faq.answer: Common issues include starting too broadly, lacking specificity, or not promising clear value. The skill analyzes your hook and offers improved alternatives with explanations.

faq.question: How is this different from general writing help?
faq.answer: This skill provides a structured workflow with specific phases: outlining, research, hook improvement, section feedback, and final polish. It tracks your voice and citations throughout.
